raw_comment:
In this graph, we can see the communication between young men and women and their parents. It is interesting to see that less than 25% of both of them visit their parents in person often. It is also interesting to see that less than 75% send texts, as that is a very easy action to do even just once a day. I wonder why girls communicate with their parents more than boys. This relates to me and my community because as a young woman I communicate with my parents and I wonder if the amount that I do that will change as I get older. I would name this graph: 
"The Curve of Kid Conversations"
ace_sentences: This graph shows communication between young men and their parents.
This graph shows communication between young women and their parents.
Less than 25% of young men visit their parents in person often.
Less than 25% of young women visit their parents in person often.
Less than 75% of young men send texts to their parents.
Less than 75% of young women send texts to their parents.
Sending a text is an easy action.
A person can send a text once a day.
Girls communicate with their parents more than boys.
I wonder why girls communicate with their parents more than boys.
I wonder if the amount of my communication with my parents will change when I get older.
The name of this graph is "The Curve of Kid Conversations".
